summary: GitHub CLI: Finding Unassigned Issues Efficiently

message.content: Show me the last 10 unassigned issues

content.text: I'll get the last 10 unassigned issues from the nrwl/nx repository for you.

input.command: gh issue list --repo nrwl/nx --state open --assignee "" --limit 10 --json number,title,createdAt,labels --template '{{range .}}#{{.number}} - {{.title}} ({{.createdAt | timeago}}){{"\n"}}{{end}}'
input.description: Get last 10 unassigned issues from nrwl/nx repo

content.text: Let me fix the template syntax:

input.command: gh issue list --repo nrwl/nx --state open --assignee "" --limit 10 --json number,title,createdAt,labels
input.description: Get last 10 unassigned issues from nrwl/nx repo in JSON format

content.text:
Here are the last 10 unassigned issues from the nrwl/nx repository:

**#31419** - @nx/webpack/app-plugin doesn't handle multiple entry point with "exports" *(bug, 3 hours ago)*

**#31417** - SQLite database contention causes 100% CPU hang with --output-style=stream --reporter=verbose *(bug, 7 hours ago)*

**#31416** - React Native App Not Running - NX Cancelled running target run-android for project @nx-project/mobileApp *(bug, 9 hours ago)*

**#31412** - Node app generated with `@nx/node:application` appears under "lib projects" in `nx graph` *(bug, 1 day ago)*

**#31411** - Adding a transform to Webpack config breaks the build *(bug, 1 day ago)*

**#31410** - Tutorial: Advanced Angular Micro Frontends with Dynamic Module Federation - Error in command *(docs, angular, low priority, 2 days ago)*

**#31408** - Nx trying to require() next.config.js file in a workspace that uses type:module *(bug, nextjs, high priority, 2 days ago)*

**#31407** - Bun CLI Output Problem with Some Bundlers (tsc, rollup, vite) *(bug, js, medium priority, 3 days ago)*

**#31401** - In @nx/eslint, --fix should respect --quiet *(bug, linter, medium priority, 3 days ago)*

**#31398** - Not clear how to enable "ciMode" for self-hosted remote cache packages *(docs, low priority, 3 days ago)*

The high priority issue #31408 about Next.js type:module compatibility looks particularly urgent.
